definition:
having or being a temperature that is uncomfortably low for humans                                      
             
             it is cold outside today

having a relatively low temperature or one lower than normal or expected                                      
             
             the bath water has gotten cold
not heated: such as

served without heating especially after initial cooking or processing                                      
             
             cold cereal

served chilled or with ice                                      
             
             a cold drink

involving processing without the use of heat                                      
             
             cold working of steel

marked by a lack of the warmth of normal human emotion, friendliness, or compassion                                      
             
             a cold stare

not colored or affected by personal feeling or bias : detached, indifferent                                      
             
             cold chronicles recorded by an outsider

marked by sure familiarity : pat                                      
             
             had her lines cold weeks before opening night
conveying the impression of being cold: such as

depressing, gloomy                                      
             
             cold gray skies
cool sense 6a

marked by the loss of normal body heat                                      
             
             cold hands

giving the appearance of being dead : unconscious                                      
             
             passed out cold

having lost freshness or vividness : stale                                      
             
             dogs trying to pick up a cold scent

far off the mark : not close to finding or solving                                      
                
                  —used especially in children's games

marked by poor or unlucky performance                                      
             
             the team's shooting turned cold in the second half

not prepared or suitably warmed up                                      
             
             The player's sub entered the game cold.

with premeditation : deliberately                                      
             
             was killed in cold blood

bodily sensation produced by loss or lack of heat                                      
             
             they died of the cold

a condition of low temperature                                      
             
             extremes of heat and cold
a bodily disorder popularly associated with chilling

deprived of benefits given others                                      
             
             the plan benefits management but leaves labor out in the cold

with utter finality : absolutely, completely                                      
             
             turned down cold

without introduction or advance notice                                      
             
             walked in cold to apply for a job

without preparation or warm-up                                      
             
             was asked to perform the solo cold
having a very low temperature
having a feeling of low body heat
not heated
a cold condition
cold weather
a common illness that affects the nose, throat, and eyes and that usually causes coughing, sneezing, etc.
in a very clear, complete, and definite way
in a sudden way
without practicing or preparing before doing something

having a low temperature or one much below normal                                      
             
             a cold day

suffering from lack of warmth                                      
             
             I feel cold.

cooled after being cooked                                      
             
             We ate cold chicken.

served at a low temperature or with ice                                      
             
             Have a cold drink.

lacking warmth of feeling : unfriendly                                      
             
             She's been cold to me ever since our disagreement.
with planning beforehand

a condition of low temperature : cold weather                                      
             
             I can't stand the cold.

the bodily feeling produced by lack of warmth : chill                                      
             
             He was shivering with cold.
common cold

having or being a temperature that is noticeably lower than body temperature and especially that is uncomfortable for humans                                      
             
             a cold drafty room

having a relatively low temperature or one that is lower than normal or expected                                      
             
             the bath water has gotten cold

receptive to the sensation of coldness : stimulated by cold                                      
             
             a cold spot is a typical receptor in higher vertebrates
dead
exhibiting little or no radioactivity
bodily sensation produced by loss or lack of heat
a bodily disorder popularly associated with chilling:
coryza
chronic obstructive lung disease

definition: with a low temperature or a temperature that is lower than normal
used about the weather
used about people and places
used about food that has been cooked but is not eaten hot
not seeming friendly or sympathetic
cold colours are colours such as white, blue, and grey that make you think of things that are cold
used especially in children’s games to tell someone that they are not close to finding or guessing something
in: The water was too cold for a shower.
It was bitterly cold that day.
a cold winter morning
I was cold, hungry, and thirsty.
freezing cold: Their house is always freezing cold.
a selection of cold meats
Her father was a cold and distant man.
She received a rather cold response.
in the cold light of day
someone’s trail/scent has gone cold

definition: at a low temperature, especially when compared to the temperature of the human body, and not hot, or warm:
not showing kindness, love, or emotion and not friendly:
If a case (= a crime or series of events) that is being investigated is cold, it has not been solved and is no longer expected to be solved:
a common infection, especially in the nose and throat, that causes you to cough and sneeze and your nose to run (= drip liquid) or feel blocked:
cold weather or temperatures:
having a low temperature, esp. when compared to the temperature of the human body, and not hot or warm:
not showing or influenced by affection, kindness, or feeling; not friendly:
a common infection, esp. in the nose and throat, which often causes you to sneeze and cough, to feel tired, and sometimes to have pain in the muscles:
The cold is cold temperature or cold weather:
in: a cold day/house
cold food/water
cold hands
cold weather
My feet are so cold.
It's freezing cold today.
You'll feel cold if you don't wear a coat.
His handshake was cold, and his eyes lifeless.
He stared into her cold, blue eyes.
She would never feel welcome in this city with its cold, unsmiling inhabitants.
The school was a cold, unwelcoming place.
The police spared no effort to keep the case from going cold.
At the time of his confession, the trail was turning cold, and investigators had given up on ever catching the killer.
I've got a cold.
She caught a cold at school.
Don't come near me - I've got a stinking/streaming cold (= extremely bad cold).
Don't stand out there in the cold, come in here and get warm.
Old people tend to feel the cold (= feel uncomfortable in cold temperatures) more than the young.
My feet were numb with cold.
I forgot my gloves and my hands are getting cold.
a cold greeting/reception
I’m afraid I’m catching a cold.
Don’t stand out there in the cold – come in here and get warm.

definition: 1. Cold (adj.) - Being low in temperature; without warmth; lacking heat.2. Cold (adj.) - Being without emotion, remorse, regret, empathy; heartless3. Cold ( adj.) - Used to describe someone who looks good; (In this sense, the word may mean the same as hot.
